question: The heating of phenyl methyl ether with HI produces an aromatic compound A which on treatment with con. <katex>$HNO_{3}$</katex> gives B. A and B respectively are:
explanation: 1. Cleavage of phenyl methyl ether (anisole) with HI produces Phenol (A) and methyl iodide.
2. Nitration of Phenol (A) with concentrated <katex>$HNO_3$</katex> yields 2,4,6-trinitrophenol, commonly known as Picric acid (B).
